articles.author: ISABEL DeBRE, EDITH M. LEDERER and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Palestinians fled in a mass exodus from northern Gaza Friday after Israel’s military told some 1 million people to evacuate toward the southern part of the besieged territory ahead of an expected ground invasion against the ruling Hamas militant group.
articles.title: Palestinians flee northern Gaza after Israel orders 1 million to evacuate as ground attack looms

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: In Muslim communities across the world, worshippers gathered at mosques for their first Friday prayers since Hamas militants attacked Israel, igniting the latest Israel-Palestinian war.
articles.title: Muslims gather at mosques for first Friday prayers since Israel-Hamas war started

articles.author: JOSEPH KRAUSS
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — In Israel's call for the evacuation of half of Gaza's population, many Palestinians fear a repeat of the most traumatic event in their tortured history, their mass exodus from what is now Israel during the 1948 war surrounding its creation.
articles.title: In Israel's call for mass evacuation, Palestinians hear echoes of their original catastrophic exodus

articles.author: LISA MASCARO, KEVIN FREKING and FARNOUSH AMIRI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Increasingly desperate Republicans convened behind closed doors again Friday as the endless search for a House speaker drags deeper into a second week leaving the GOP majority spiraling into chaos for the foreseeable future.
articles.title: Republicans quickly eye Trump-backed hard-liner Jim Jordan as House speaker, but not all back him

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The White House said on Friday that North Korea has delivered more than 1,000 containers of military equipment and munitions to Russia for its ongoing war in Ukraine.
articles.title: US says North Korea delivered 1,000 containers of equipment and munitions to Russia for Ukraine war

articles.author: JOHN LEICESTER, SAMUEL PETREQUIN and JEFFREY SCHAEFFER
articles.description: ARRAS, France (AP) — France’s interior minister says the suspect in a deadly school stabbing had been detained for questioning the day before on suspicion of radicalism, but investigators found no weapon or threat or indication that he was preparing an attack.
articles.title: Suspect in French teacher's slaying was held for questioning the night before attack, minister says

articles.author: CHEYANNE MUMPHREY and ANNIE MA
articles.description: For more than a month, Darryl George, a Black high school student in Texas, spent each school day sitting by himself in punishment over his hairstyle.
articles.title: Black student disciplined over hairstyle hopes to 'start being a kid again'

articles.author: CLAUDIA LAUER, REBECCA BOONE and AUDREY McAVOY
articles.description: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) — Audio of 911 calls from a deadly August wildfire released late Thursday by Maui County authorities reveals a terrifying and chaotic scene as the inferno swept through the historic town of Lahaina and people desperately tried to escape burning homes and flames licking at cars in gridlocked traffic.
articles.title: AP Exclusive: 911 calls from deadly Lahaina wildfire reveal terror and panic in the rush to escape

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court avoided a catastrophic accident last year when a piece of marble at least 2 feet long crashed to the ground in an interior courtyard used by the justices and their aides, according to several court employees.
articles.title: The Supreme Court avoided disaster when a chunk of marble fell in a courtyard used by the justices

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — NASA’s Psyche spacecraft rocketed away Friday on a six-year journey to a rare metal-covered asteroid.Most asteroids tend to be rocky or icy, and this is the first exploration of a metal world.
articles.title: NASA spacecraft launched to mysterious and rare metal asteroid in first mission of its kind
